title: Hajj 2026 in Oman: Registration opens soon, important dates and how to apply

Citizens and residents aged 18 and above can apply online through www.hajj.om. Selection is automatic based on Saudi Arabia’s quota. Applicants will be notified via SMS in October and November, with strict guidelines to ensure a smooth process.

title: Which Indian tech jobs are at risk and who could gain?
description: Peter Navarro's endorsement of tariffs on outsourcing has sparked concerns in India's IT sector, potentially impacting the $283-billion industry. The debate, fueled by right-wing commentators, raises the possibility of US companies reducing outsourcing to India. This shift could lead to hiring freezes and slower promotions for Indian tech professionals, while those with specialized skills may gain.

Maharashtra polls 'stolen' claim: Cong alleges Trai blocked SMS outreach; regulator denies claim
description: Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (Trai) has denied Congress's allegation of rejecting their SMS application regarding a documentary on the Maharashtra 2024 elections. Trai clarified that it doesn't approve individual SMS templates and the rejection was by the service provider, STPL. Congress leaders criticized Trai's action, linking it to efforts to suppress information about alleged election fraud.

title: Apple event tomorrow: iPhone 17, AirPods Pro 3, Apple Watch Ultra 3; everything expected
description: Apple's biggest product launch of the year – the unveiling of new iPhones and more – is set for September 9. The Cupertino giant is highly expected to reveal the iPhone 17 series at the "Awe Dropping" event, marking a significant departure from recent iPhone designs. The iPhone 17 lineup will include four models – iPhone 17, iPhone 17 Air, iPhone 17 Pro, and iPhone 17 Pro Max – alongside new Apple Watches and AirPods. Here's everything we know about Apple's upcoming hardware showcase.

title: Bad Girl movie review: Coming-of-age Tamil film smashes patriarchy without bringing a hammer to it

6.6 lakh students appear for West Bengal’s first-ever class 12 semester exam
Watch: M S Dhoni spotted in his vintage Rolls-Royce on Ranchi streets, young fan chases car
Megan Thee Stallion sues Adin Ross: Shocking reason revealed
description: Rapper Megan Thee Stallion has sued streamer Adin Ross. The lawsuit is regarding Ross's comments on the Tory Lanez shooting incident. Stallion's legal team accuses Ross of spreading misinformation. Ross confirmed he was served legal papers in an unusual way. A mariachi band appeared at his home to deliver the deposition.

title: Social media ban in Nepal: At least 18 dead as youths clash with police
description: Thousands of young Nepalis protested in Kathmandu against the government's ban on 26 social media platforms, leading to clashes with police and multiple casualties. Demonstrators expressed anger over the blackout and broader frustration with corruption, chanting slogans and attempting to storm the Parliament. The government imposed curfews and justified the ban by citing non-compliance with local registration requirements.

description: Indian Railways is set to launch its first Vande Bharat sleeper train in the coming weeks, aiming to provide a faster and more comfortable travel experience than the Rajdhani Express. The initial service is expected to operate from Delhi to destinations around 1,000 kilometers away, such as Ahmedabad, Bhopal, and Patna.

title: Amaal Mallik ‘can handle toxicity like a boss’, says brother Armaan Malik as Salman Khan schools him for ‘sleeping’ on Bigg Boss 19
Red Sea cables cut: Microsoft updates; why the route is critical for Asia, Mideast
description: Undersea cable cuts in the Red Sea have significantly disrupted internet services across regions including India, Saudi Arabia, Pakistan, and the UAE, causing slowed connectivity and increased latency. The disruptions, attributed to failures affecting the SMW4 and IMEWE cable systems near Jeddah, Saudi Arabia, highlight the Red Sea's critical role in global internet data flow, impacting cloud and network services.

title: Who is Sama Kamel? Meet the newly crowned Miss Egypt 2025
description: Crowned Miss Egypt 2025, Sama Kamel captivated the nation with a sky-blue, crystal-studded gown, a flowing satin cape, and a golden crown symbolizing ambition and triumph, while her poised presence, growing Instagram following, and trending status across search engines cemented her not just as a beauty queen, but as a rising cultural figure of elegance, strength, and aspiration

title: Burhanpur: 3 injured, 7 held after stone-pelting during Hanuman Chalisa recitation
description: In Biroda village, Indore, a Hanuman Chalisa recitation was disrupted by stone-pelting, injuring at least three individuals. Police have arrested seven suspects following the incident, which occurred around 8:30 pm. Authorities, led by SP Ashutosh Bagri, have filed a case and deployed additional forces to maintain order.

Who is Bhanu Tatak and why did immigration block her travel to Ireland?
description: Anti-dam activist Bhanu Tatak was stopped at Delhi airport due to a lookout circular linked to pending police cases in Arunachal Pradesh. These cases involve alleged criminal trespass in 2021 and financing vandalism in 2022, claims she denies, alleging harassment for her opposition to hydropower projects. The incident has sparked political controversy, with accusations of silencing dissent.

description: Arijit Singh's London concert at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium ended abruptly, sparking online reactions. Despite a mesmerizing performance featuring hits like 'Saiyaara' and 'Jhoome Jo Pathaan,' the show was allegedly cut short due to curfew restrictions.

title: 'Put down your weapons or ... ': Israel issues 'final' ultimatum to Hamas
description: Israeli Defence Minister Israel Katz issued a stark ultimatum to Hamas, demanding the release of hostages and disarmament, or face the complete destruction of Gaza and their own annihilation. Katz emphasized the IDF's ongoing operations and preparations for expanded maneuvers to decisively defeat Hamas.

US scraps third-country visas: Indian students to face backlogs; tougher interviews
description: Indian students now face tougher U.S. visa rules, including the end of third-country applications and mandatory interviews, causing longer waits and uncertainty. Proposed fixed-term visas and stricter compliance requirements add to the challenges. These changes increase costs and risks for Indian families investing in U.S. education, potentially delaying academic pursuits.

Global power shifts, economic pragmatism are bringing India and China back to the negotiating table. But for how long?
Terror network under scanner: NIA raids 22 locations; searches across five states
description: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) conducted extensive raids across 22 locations in five states and Jammu and Kashmir on Monday, targeting a terror conspiracy case. These coordinated searches, spanning Bihar, Karnataka, Maharashtra, Tamil Nadu, Uttar Pradesh, and J&K, aimed to uncover evidence related to terror financing, recruitment, and cross-border coordination.

Trump tariff impact: How much will India’s GDP growth be hit? What CEA said
description: Chief Economic Adviser V. Anantha Nageswaran estimates that US President Trump's 50% tariffs could reduce India's GDP growth by 0.5% to 0.6%. While the US tariffs impact export competitiveness, India's growth relies more on domestic consumption. Experts suggest the tariff impact could be limited.

title: NMC directs PG medical students to be deployed in flood-affected areas
San Jose jewel heist: Car rams into jewellery store, masked mob storms inside - watch
description: In San Jose, a shocking smash-and-grab robbery targeted Kim Hung Jewellery, leaving the 88-year-old owner injured after masked suspects rammed a car into the store. The brazen daylight heist involved over a dozen individuals who looted the shop, assaulting the owner in the process. Police are investigating the armed robbery as the suspects remain at large, and the community grapples with concerns over safety.

'Will have to refund': US secy explains what will happen if SC rules against tariffs
description: US treasury secretary Scott Bessent stated the department might need to refund roughly half of collected tariffs if the Supreme Court finds Donald Trump's tariffs exceeded presidential authority. A federal appeals court already ruled the tariffs exceeded authority, casting doubt on trade talks. The administration appealed to the Supreme Court, cautioning that eliminating tariffs could weaken the nation.

Mandya clash: Stone pelting mars Ganpati procession in K'taka - what we know so far
description: Tensions flared in Maddur, Mandya district, after stone-pelting incidents disrupted a Lord Ganesh idol immersion procession, leading to clashes between communities. Police responded with a lathi charge to disperse protesters and imposed Section 144 to control the unrest. Several arrests have been made, and additional forces have been deployed to maintain peace and prevent further escalation in the sensitive areas.

‘Insult to Manipur people’: Congress slams PM Modi over rushed '3-hour visit' to state
description: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh has criticised Prime Minister Narendra Modi's planned visit to Manipur on September 13, calling it an insult to the state's residents who have been awaiting his attention for nearly 29 months. Ramesh highlighted the brevity of the visit, lasting only three hours, questioning its purpose and impact.

title: UP man killed by wife, lover using drug-laced tea; buried in backyard
description: In Kanpur, Lakshmi and her lover Amit Singh are arrested. They are accused of murdering Lakshmi's husband, Shivbeer Singh. Shivbeer was allegedly sedated and killed with a pickaxe. His body was buried in their home's backyard. Savitri Devi, Shivbeer's mother, filed a missing person complaint. Police investigation led to the exhumation of skeletal remains.

title: ‘Leave Sanju Samson alone, let Shubman Gill come in for someone else’: Ravi Shastri ahead of India’s Asia Cup opener
Apple Watch Series 11, Apple Watch Ultra 3, Apple Watch SE, AirPods Pro 3: Everything you can expect
'Adequate food, attached toilet': How India plans to keep Choksi in Mumbai jail; all you need to know
description: The Indian government has assured Belgian authorities of humane detention conditions for Mehul Choksi if he's extradited to India for the PNB fraud case. These assurances, detailing facility specifications and healthcare provisions at Mumbai's Arthur Road Jail, aim to meet international human rights standards.

title: 'Losses must be felt': Zelenskyy backs Trump tariffs on nations supporting Russia; message for India?
description: Amidst the ongoing conflict, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has endorsed the US tariffs on nations supporting Russia through trade, emphasizing that strong actions, including sanctions and trade restrictions, are crucial. He accused Putin of avoiding negotiations, attributing Russia's economic troubles to this refusal. Zelenskyy also highlighted a recent major attack on Kyiv.

Historic chess victory! How Divya Deshmukh beat Africa's Bassem Amin at FIDE Grand Swiss
description: Teen chess prodigy GM Divya Deshmukh, after a shaky start at the Grand Swiss, stunned Africa's top-rated GM Bassem Amin. Playing with black, Divya showcased resilience in the Sicilian Defence, capitalising on Amin's aggressive play. Despite a challenging opening, she seized the initiative, converting a rook sacrifice into a decisive advantage.

A'ja Wilson sets WNBA record: Surpasses Moore, Loyd; Aces defeat Sky
description: A'ja Wilson's record-breaking 31-point performance propelled the Las Vegas Aces to their 15th consecutive win against the Chicago Sky, further solidifying her MVP candidacy. Wilson surpassed Jewell Loyd and Maya Moore for most 30-point games in a season. The Aces' dominant victory, coupled with contributions from Jackie Young and Chelsea Gray, underscores their readiness for a strong title defense.

description: A joint operation by the Army, CRPF, and J&K Police in Kulgam's Guddar forest led to an encounter with terrorists following specific intelligence inputs. The gunfight resulted in the elimination of two terrorists, while a junior commissioned officer sustained injuries during the exchange.

'Entered via donkey route': Haryana man killed in US for objecting to public urination
description: Kapil, a 26-year-old Indian security guard from Haryana, was fatally shot in California after confronting a man for public urination. He had traveled to the US via the "donkey route" two and a half years ago. The village is in mourning and supporting the family, who are seeking government assistance to bring his body back to India.

title: Noida teen batters father to death with brick, then goes to sleep
description: In a shocking incident in Noida's Safrabad, a 19-year-old, Uday, allegedly murdered his father, Gautam, following a dispute over property. Intoxicated at the time, Uday reportedly bludgeoned Gautam with a brick after the father refused to transfer ownership of a shop. The crime came to light when Gautam's brother discovered the body.
